channel.title: Payer rights
channel.description: im just wondering how can i make another player right in this case like a 4. im running atomicscape 562 source and all help will be appreicated thanks - nardo

item.title: Payer rights
item.dc:creator: @nardoscape nardoscape
item.description:
@nardoscape wrote:

well where do i put the code if playrights !=4?? player.java? and i will make a crown and stuff. thanks

item.title: Payer rights
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:4, topic:328852”][quote author=Owned_Pl0xs link=topic=425244.msg3123141#msg3123141 date=1265755054]
It’s usually changed in the character file since the rights is saved into the character file.

Or you can do this in your login method:

//code
[/quote]

I think he is trying to add an entire now playerLevel, playerLevel 4 for donators or something.[/quote]

Then in some codes do

if(playerRights != 4) {
sendMessage(“You need to be a donator to do this action”);
return;
}

to spice it up, make it so playerrights 4 has a crown of their own, which is done client sided and is fairly easy on any revision client.

also, another way of actually making people donator is doing it SQL wise by checking the usergroup on the forum or just writing the names to a file and checking that on login.

Read full topic

item.title: Payer rights
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

It’s usually changed in the character file since the rights is saved into the character file.

Or you can do this in your login method:

if(playerName.equals("Your Name")) {
    player.rights = 2;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Payer rights
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

I’ve never ran over a 317. But If I were to GUESS. From what people have told me, I beleive it’s in Player.java.
And instead of putting like: Playerrights = 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 or 4.
It’s just your name, So I’d search for some shit like “Admin” or “playerrights” or “rights” or something along those lines, hope this helped. good luck.
